productInterestingFacts: Coca-Cola was first introduced in the late 19th century as a patent medicine.
Coca-Cola is available in over 200 countries worldwide with a diverse range of flavours.
Coca-Cola is one of the most recognized and consumed beverage brands globally.

Water.description: Essential component of human body and major ingredient.
effects: Promotes hydration
Maintains bodily functions
Flushes out toxins

Sugar.description: Adds sweetness and contributes to caloric content.
effects: Increases risk of obesity
Raises blood sugar levels
Contributes to dental cavities

Carbon Dioxide.description: Creates fizz and carbonation in the beverage.
effects: May lead to bloating or gas in some individuals
Neutral effect on overall health
Can be detrimental in excessive consumption

Colour E150d.description: Artificial colouring that gives Coca-Cola its distinct colour.
effects: Linked to cancer risks in animal studies
Potential allergy in some individuals
Neutral effect in moderate consumption

Phosphoric Acid.description: Contributes to the tangy and acidic taste of Coca-Cola.
effects: May lead to tooth erosion or decay in excessive consumption
Neutral effect in moderate consumption
Potential risks of kidney stones

Natural Flavourings.description: Non-specific term that includes natural essences or extracts.
effects: Variable effects depending on specific flavourings used
Potential allergy in some individuals
General neutral effect

Caffeine.description: A stimulant added to promote alertness and energy.
effects: May disrupt sleep patterns
Raises blood pressure in some individuals
Increases alertness and boosts energy

healthRecommendations: Consume Coca-Cola in moderation (1-2 servings a week) due to its high sugar content and artificial ingredients.
Balance Coca-Cola consumption with a healthy diet and regular exercise routine.
Consider alternative beverages, such as water or fruit juices, to minimize exposure to artificial ingredients and added sugars.
Avoid mixing Coca-Cola with other caffeinated beverages or medications to avoid increased caffeine effects.

productInterestingFacts: Choco Pie is a popular South Korean snack food introduced in 1973.
Choco Pie consists of two chocolate-coated marshmallow snacks.
This product has a significant following worldwide due to its nostalgic appeal.

Enriched Wheat Flour.description: Bleached and enriched flour with iron, thiamine, and folate.
effects: Digestive issues in gluten-intolerant individuals
Nutrient imbalances due to processed nature
Risk of empty calorie consumption

effects: Contributes to dietary issues like obesity and diabetes
Can lead to energy crashes and mood swings
